inclusion.criterion: Severe, bicuspid aortic stenosis: Mean gradient ≥40 mmHg
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Active sepsis, including active bacterial endocarditis with or without treatment;
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Evidence of an acute myocardial infarction ≤ 1 month (30 days) before the intended treatment [(defined as: Q wave MI, or non-Q wave MI with total CK elevation of CK-MB ≥ twice normal in the presence of MB elevation and/or troponin level elevation (WHO definition)];
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Stroke or transient ischemic attack (TIA) within 3 months (90 days) of the procedure.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has severe aortic stenosis with worsening LV function and EF was 25%. He underwent cardiac cath with right heart cath to evaluate his pulm art pressures which showed no angiographically apparent flow-limiting coronary artery disease.
